issue.name: SQL Injection in request parameter
issue.issueBackground: SQL injection vulnerabilities arise when user-controllable data is incorporated into SQL queries without proper validation or escaping. This can allow an attacker to manipulate queries, access or modify database contents, or bypass authentication. 🔍 This request uses a vulnerable parameter to inject SQL: `id=1' OR '1'='1`. 💡 AI Advice: Use parameterized queries or stored procedures to prevent injection. Avoid directly concatenating user input in SQL statements.
